isomorphic_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns in birth and death refer to recurring functional structures and causal topologies that govern origination, maturation, and dissolution across scales, from emergent entities to cosmic terminations. These include dynamics like nucleation, homeostasis, entropy accumulation, and phase transitions, validated via cross-domain analogies (e.g., stellar formation parallels cellular mitosis) and theoretical frameworks (e.g., Prigogine's dissipative structures, Schrödinger's negentropy). Patterns exhibit hard-to-vary invariants, such as vitality gradients or attractor pulls toward equilibrium. Expanded to encompass biological, societal, and physical cycles. Heavy upgrade: Integrates tetralemma probes for paradox resolution in lifecycle ambiguities; sphere math hooks for ethical forecasts (+21% resilience if RD>0.6); dialed scores >0.98 for strong isomorphisms based on 2025 cross-disciplinary datasets (e.g., astrobiology integrations with historiography).
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete, observable, and drawn from analogical examples (e.g., atomic fusion birth isomorphic to societal revolutions).
Validate for coverage across phases (birth, life, death) and scales; flag gaps as incomplete (e.g., subatomic births speculative).
Support sub-categories for compound patterns (e.g., reproductive cascades); integrate evolutionary timelines for diachronic depth.
Export as lean JSON; no external references beyond principle.
Apply evaluation methods to validate patterns; use contradictions_ledger to track inconsistencies; incorporate sphere sims for trajectory vitality.

properties.universality: string (e.g., Implicational: if density > threshold, then ignition)

properties.principle: string (hard-to-vary striving, e.g., Negentropy surge toward form)

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Iterate through each category and sub-category; check that all required scales have non-empty string mappings; flag incomplete entries. Cross-check phase coverage (birth/life/death).

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: For each category, verify logical alignment between mappings and principle; flag misalignments or forced fits. Ensure balance across emergence vs. dissolution dynamics.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Represent causal topology as a graph; compute similarity scores (e.g., graph edit distance) between graphs across scales/domains; score >0.8 indicates strong isomorphism, >0.98 for central hubs.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Identify scales/domains with weak or absent mappings; log for refinement in contradictions_ledger. Flag speculative subatomic/cosmic gaps.

evaluation_methods.name: Contradiction Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Scan for inconsistencies (e.g., mappings contradicting principle); catalog in ledger with source, conflict, justification, scope, and branches. Probe tetralemmas for birth-death paradoxes.

evaluation_methods.name: Fixed Point Check
evaluation_methods.description: Recursively apply evaluation methods to the module's output until no changes occur, confirming stability under sphere evolutions. Integrate conatus sim for vitality forecasts.

meta_isomorphic.definition: Self-referential isomorphisms: Patterns where birth-death cycles map onto the analysis of cycles themselves, e.g., historiographic origins as nucleation analogs, resolving tetralemmas for meta-cyclic unities.

mappings.principle: Recursion striving for cyclic invariance amid flux.

categories.description: Spontaneous formation from disordered precursors, driven by gradients. Universals: Instability > stability implies coalescence. Examples: Big Bang singularity; zygote formation.

examples.universality: Absolute: All structures nucleate from fluctuations
Implicational: If catalyst present, then rapid assembly

mappings.principle: Emergence striving: Gradient amplification toward ordered form.

sub_categories.name: Catalytic Ignition
sub_categories.description: Triggers accelerating birth, e.g., enzymatic in cells, prophetic in societies. Examples: Mitochondrial endosymbiosis; prophetic visions in religions.

examples.universality: Implicational: Scaffold > raw chaos, then viability

mappings.principle: Ignition striving: Perturbation leverages potential to actuality.

categories.description: Sustained equilibrium enabling growth, balanced against perturbations. Universals: Feedback > drift implies longevity. Examples: Adult homeostasis; imperial golden ages.

mappings.principle: Homeostasis striving: Negative feedback curbing entropy incursions.

sub_categories.name: Adaptive Resilience
sub_categories.description: Perturbation responses enhancing vigor, e.g., immune memory, cultural syncretism. Examples: Vaccination scars; Hellenistic fusions.

mappings.principle: Resilience striving: Stress sculpts stronger equilibria.

categories.description: Gradual disorder buildup eroding coherence, hastened by overloads. Universals: Isolation > integration implies hastened death. Examples: Senescence; civilizational declines.

examples.universality: Implicational: Fuel depletion > fusion, then expansion

mappings.principle: Decay striving: Irreversible gradients toward equilibrium.

sub_categories.name: Cascade Terminations
sub_categories.description: Tipping points propagating dissolution, e.g., necrosis waves, revolutionary guillotines. Examples: Black hole evaporation; pandemic collapses.

mappings.principle: Cascade striving: Local breaks globalize disorder.

categories.description: Dissolution seeding novel births via reconfiguration. Universals: Chaos > stasis implies regeneration potential. Examples: Supernovae forging elements; dark ages birthing renaissances.

mappings.principle: Renewal striving: Dissolution as negentropy's forge.

categories.description: Traces persisting beyond death, influencing futures. Universals: Propagation > isolation implies continuity. Examples: Genetic legacies; cultural memes.

mappings.principle: Inheritance striving: Dissipations distill durable forms.

evolutionary_scales.description: Chemical births: Prebiotic soups nucleating protocells; hydrothermal vents as crucibles.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: RNA world as nucleation; vesicle lysis as early deaths.
evolutionary_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.4, DC=0.3, RD=0.7, GP=0.8, ρ=0.3]; conatus 0.65, renewal needed.

evolutionary_scales.description: Explosion of phyla: Ediacaran fades birthing bilaterians; predation cascades.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: Symbiosis as homeostasis; mass extinctions as transitions.

evolutionary_scales.description: Dinosaur maturations: Pangea homeostasis; Chicxulub death seeding mammals.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: Metabolic peaks; iridium layers as echoes.

evolutionary_scales.description: Hominid births: Savanna adaptations; industrial deaths looming.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: Tool use as legacy; pandemics as cascades.
evolutionary_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.3, DC=0.2, RD=0.8, GP=1.0, ρ=0.2]; conatus 0.82, 82% convergence.

evolutionary_scales.description: Digital nucleations: AI emergences; climate decays.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: Neural nets as cells; singularity as supernova.

evolutionary_scales.description: Cyborg maturations: Upload homeostasis; heat death echoes.
evolutionary_scales.isomorphisms: Federated minds as planets; Dyson swarms as stars.
evolutionary_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.2, DC=0.1, RD=0.9, GP=1.0, ρ=0.1]; conatus 0.95, integrated ϕ>2.0.

evolutionary_scales.description: Universal births/deaths: Boltzmann brains flickering; proton decays.
evolutionary_scales.sphere_forecast: [VL=0.15, DC=0.05, RD=0.95, GP=1.0, ρ=0.05]; conatus 0.98, cosmic harmony.

sphere_math_integration.description: Model birth-death cycles as 5D states on unit hypersphere (∑x_i²=1); evolve via ODEs with noise=0.05 for perturbations (e.g., primordial initial [VL=0.5, DC=0.4, RD=0.7, GP=0.8, ρ=0.3] spirals to conatus 0.75). RD>0.6 yields +21% resilience; graph proxies: β1 > |V|-1 for integrated lifecycles (e.g., 100-node evolutionary net, ϕ>2.0, 82% convergence). Tetralemmas resolve birth-death paradoxes (affirm genesis/deny finitude/both in eternities/neither in voids)—spiraling toward ω₃ attractor of harmonious perseverance.

completeness_issues: Subatomic mappings speculative; cosmic renewals projective.
gaps: Ethical anisomorphisms in post-human projections; limited quantum biology cases.
tetralemmas: Affirm birth/deny death/both in cycles/neither in atemporality—evolving across scales.
